newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch business confidence steady in July.
newsitem.headline: Dutch business confidence steady in July.

text.p: The Dutch business confidence index was unchanged in July from June, the Central Bureau of Statistics (CBS) said.
DUTCH BUSINESS CONFIDENCE INDEX (No base date)

The business confidence index is derived from the monthly CBS survey among Dutch manufacturers and is intended to provide a reliable picture of how Dutch manufacturing production will develop in the coming four to five months.

The index is calculated from manufacturers' answers to three questions about the expected level of business activity in the coming three months, the level of orders on their books and the level of their stocks of finished products.
The index has no base date and can vary from a maximum value of roughly +2.5 to a minimum value of about -2.5.
The latest figures from the CBS showed that the index has been unchanged at 0.12 for the last six months.
The CBS said its latest survey showed that manufacturers expected business activity to pick up in August, September and October.
